{"step_by_step_thinking": "The preoperational stage is a stage of cognitive development in Piaget's theory. During this stage, children develop the ability to use symbols and represent objects with words and images. They also begin to engage in pretend play and have an egocentric perspective. The preoperational stage typically occurs between the ages of 2 and 7 years. Therefore, the correct answer is B. 2-7 years.", "answer_choice": "B"}
